page.title: 01REVIEW
page.content: { }The twelve square kilometres of this block are largely dominated by the town of{Burgess Hill}in the North- Eastern block of four squares. The town contains over 95% of the population of the block, including the projects two contributory schools. The town developed with the coming of the London-Brighton railway. Being situated on a{clay bed}a flourishing brick-works and pottery developed. The town now has been redeveloped to{light {industry,}warehousing and office accommodation. There is new and {expanding housing}for commuters to London, and for workers at Gatwick Airport, the ever{expanding industrial {estate}and the renewed shopping area. The countryside squares are a mixture of{managed grassland}and {cereal crops.}There is ample access through ancient{rights of way.
